senses.de: A particular point or period in a process of development or change
senses.ex: The project is in its final stage

Tips.title: Development Process
Tips.description: Use 'stage' when describing steps in growth or making something.
Tips.example: Her language skills are at the intermediate stage.

Tips.title: Change Over Time
Tips.description: 'Stage' often signifies a temporary status during change.
Tips.example: This stage of rapid expansion is critical for our startup.

senses.de: A raised platform where performers perform
senses.ex: The actors took to the stage

Tips.title: Performance Area
Tips.description: 'Stage' refers to where performances happen, usually elevated.
Tips.example: She felt confident once she stepped onto the stage.

Tips.title: Focus of Attention
Tips.description: 'Taking center stage' means becoming the main focus.
Tips.example: Climate change has taken center stage in global discussions.

senses.de: To organize and present a play, concert or other show
senses.ex: The company is staging a new play

Tips.title: Show Organization
Tips.description: To 'stage' a show means planning and executing it.
Tips.example: The community center staged a charity concert last week.

Tips.title: Event Planning
Tips.description: Use 'stage' for the act of arranging events, not just theatre.
Tips.example: They staged a successful event for entrepreneurs.

senses.de: A section of a journey or race
senses.ex: The next stage of our journey was the most difficult

Tips.title: Travel Segments
Tips.description: 'Stage' in travel implies a part of a larger journey.
Tips.example: Our next stage involves a ferry trip to the islands.

Tips.title: Sports Milestones
Tips.description: In races, 'stage' suggests a section of the competition.
Tips.example: He took the lead in the final stage of the tour.

senses.de: To organize and participate in a public event to express a view
senses.ex: They are staging a protest against the government's policies

Tips.title: Active Protest
Tips.description: 'Stage' a protest indicates organizing and carrying it out.
Tips.example: Activists staged a sit-in outside the city hall.

Tips.title: Emphasizing Action
Tips.description: Using 'stage' highlights the effort behind public expressions.
Tips.example: The workers staged a strike for better wages.

senses.de: A level or grade in a system, such as in education or society
senses.ex: He is at the elementary stage of learning English

Tips.title: Education Levels
Tips.description: 'Stage' can mark different levels in learning or progression.
Tips.example: I'm at the stage where I can hold a basic conversation.

Tips.title: Social Hierarchy
Tips.description: Used to indicate one's position in society or a system.
Tips.example: He reached a high stage in the company's hierarchy.

Arena.wordDefinition:
Arena typically refers to a large, open space where events such as sports games, concerts or performances take place.

Arena is used for events that are often large and open, while stage is used for performances that are usually indoors in a theater or performance venue.

Dais.wordDefinition:
A dais is a raised platform, often at the end of a room or hall, that provides a special place for important people to sit or stand.

A dais is used for formal occasions while a stage is used for performances.

Platform.wordDefinition:
Platform is usually used to refer to a raised flat surface, like a stage, but it can also mean a place where people can have a voice and share their ideas.

This idea of a platform is often used in politics or social media, where people can share their views with a larger audience.

A stage is specifically a raised platform used for performers to showcase their talents. It is most commonly found in theaters or music venues.

So, while they both refer to elevated surfaces, platform can be more general and speak to a place where people can voice their ideas, whereas stage is more specific and is used for live performances.

Podium.wordDefinition:
A podium is a raised platform used by a speaker to speak or to make a presentation.

It is usually in front of an audience, and the speaker stands on top of it to be seen and heard more clearly. Podiums are commonly used in formal settings such as conferences, ceremonies, and speeches.

It is often larger than a podium and may have many levels, curtains, and lighting equipment. Performers use the stage to showcase their talents and entertain their audience.

In summary, podiums are used mainly for speeches and presentations, while stages are used mainly for performances.

Rostrum.wordDefinition:
A rostrum is a raised platform used for speaking or giving a speech, often in a formal setting like a university or government building.

A rostrum is a specific type of stage used for speeches and presentations, while a general stage can be used for a variety of performances in many settings.

Spotlight.wordDefinition:
Spotlight and stage are both words used to refer to a performance space, but there are some differences between them.

A spotlight is a bright, focused beam of light used to highlight a specific person or object on a stage or in a performance.

A spotlight is a tool used to draw attention to specific parts of a performance, while a stage is the entire area where the performance takes place.

Theatre.wordDefinition:
A theatre is a place where plays, musicals, or other performances are staged, while a stage is the platform or area where the actors perform.

A theatre can include multiple stages, while a stage is a component of a theatre. The term stage is also used in settings outside of a theater, such as a concert or a school assembly.

quotes.Text: I had no idea of the character. But the moment I was dressed, the clothes and the make-up made me feel the person he was. I began to know him, and by the time I walked onto the stage he was fully born.
quotes.Title: English Actor
quotes.Name: Charlie Chaplin

quotes.Text: You're not a rock n' roll person four hours a day or even when you're on stage. It's become the rhythm of your whole life.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Patti Smith

quotes.Text: Remember that as a teenager you are in the last stage of your life when you will be happy to hear the phone is for you.
quotes.Title: American Journalist
quotes.Name: Fran Lebowitz

quotes.Text: I'm ready to help China realize its football dream. I think China can be a major player on the world stage one day.
quotes.Title: Brazilian Athlete
quotes.Name: Ronaldo

quotes.Text: I hold the world but as the world, Gratiano; A stage where every man must play a part, And mine is a sad one.
quotes.Title: English Playwright
quotes.Name: William Shakespeare

quotes.Text: I don't want to be 60 years old standing on stage telling some jokes. I want my life to mean something.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Steve Harvey

quotes.Text: You've got to get to the stage in life where going for it is more important than winning or losing.
quotes.Title: American Tennis Player
quotes.Name: Arthur Ashe

quotes.Text: At times in my life the only place I have been happy is when I am on stage.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Bob Dylan

quotes.Text: The world is a stage, but the play is badly cast.
quotes.Title: Irish Poet
quotes.Name: Oscar Wilde

quotes.Text: We kind of deny the stages of life.
quotes.Title: American Novelist
quotes.Name: Chuck Palahniuk
